title: socialgene/sgnf pipeline parameters
description: Scalable genome mining with SocialGene knowledge graphs

input_genomes.title: Input Genomes
input_genomes.description: Any one or more of the following can be used to download/input genomes for the pipeline

ncbi_genome_download_command.help_text:
See the following link for more info about commands you can use:
https://github.com/kblin/ncbi-genome-download

ncbi_datasets_command.description: Taxonomic name  (maybe NCBI taxonomy id as well?) see extended help before using
ncbi_datasets_command.help_text:
Note/Warning: 
Specifying a taxon directly has the potential to download a large number of genomes that you may not be prepared to handle.
I highly recommend searching here (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/genome/browse#!/prokaryotes/) first to get an idea of how many input genomes you can expect.


The input argument you provide s replace the `$params.ncbi_datasets_command` in the command below:

`datasets download $params.ncbi_datasets_command --dehydrated $args`

The value of `$args` is set in https://github.com/socialgene/sgnf/blob/main/conf/modules.config

Info on use of NCBI datasets can be found here: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/datasets/docs/v1/reference-docs/command-line/datasets/

ncbi_datasets_file.description: Instead of using the 'ncbi_datasets_command', the path to a file of NCBI genome accessions to download can provided (single accessio per line)

local_genbank.description: Path to local GenBank file(s), can be a glob
local_genbank.help_text:
Accepted files:
gbff, gbk
and gzipped versions of those

local_fasta.description: Path to local protein FASTA file(s), can be a glob

paired_omics_json_path.description: Paired omics json file, downloaded from: https://pairedomicsdata.bioinformatics.nl/projects

mibig.description: Set to true to download and include all MIBiG BGCs as input

genbank_input_buffer.description: How many genbank files will be processed in a single task
genbank_input_buffer.help_text: Decides how many parallel processes  will be used for genbank parsing; number of spawned parse processes = (# of input genomes) / (genbank_input_buffer)

defline_magic.help_text: set to true if input fasta files contain uniprot deflines (sp| or tr|) (e.g. from uniprot fasta downloads) named defline_magic because may expand to other defline formats in the future
defline_magic.description: set to true if input fasta files contain uniprot deflines (sp| or tr|)

output_directories.title: Output Directories
output_directories.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

outdir.description: If set, and others not, all other outdirs within this directory

outdir_download_cache.description: Long term caching directory for use between different pipeline runs.

outdir_per_run.description: Directory that holds data generated each run

outdir_neo4j.description: Path to the output directory where the results will be saved.

outdir_blast_cache.description: Cache folder where blast results are written to. Important to delete if starting a new pipeline run with different input data but using same cache directory as a previous run.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

fasta_splits.description: Split non-redundant protein sequences into n-FASTA files
fasta_splits.help_text: Use this to run HMMER in parallel/make things faster. Determines how many FASTA files should be the created from all non-redundant protein sequences

hmm_splits.description: For most use cases keep this at 1 and increase fasta_splits instead
hmm_splits.help_text: Determines how many hmm files should be created to run in parallel. This is mainly for making smaller files for massively parallel distribution on CHTC

include_sequences.description: Include protein sequences in the Neo4j database?

antismash_fulljson.description: Keep full antismash output json? Can take up a lot of space for large datasets

socialgene_modules.title: SocialGene modules
socialgene_modules.description: These determine the annotations and structure of the resulting database

build_database.description: Should the Neo4j databse be created?

blastp.description: Should all vs all  BLASTp be run? DO NOT RUN ON LARGE INPUT DATA WITHOUT STRICT FILTERS

hmmlist.description: Comma-separated string (e.g. 'antismash,amrfinder) or 'all', see extended help for all options

mmseqs_steps.description: Descending, comma-delimited string of levels to cluster to- e.g. '90,80,70''

ncbi_taxonomy.description: Download and insert the NCBI taxonomy database? Requires input assemblies to have NCBI  Assembly accessions

antismash.description: Run antismash on all input genomes

chembl.description: Include chembl data into database Not yet implemented

goterms.description: Download and process go term ontology

max_job_resources.title: Max Job Resources
max_job_resources.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_resources.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that these values only set the max, to increase the actual resources requested by any single process you will need to set up your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text:
Used to set an upper-limit for the number of CPUs that can be used at once. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#process-cpus

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text:
Used to set an upper-limit for the memory any single process can use.  Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#process-memory

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text:
Used to set an upper-limit for the amount of time any single process is allowed to run. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#time

slurm_queue_size.description: Number of slurm jobs that can be running/submitted

advanced_hmm_input.title: Advanced HMM Input
advanced_hmm_input.description: Any one or more of the following can be used to download/input HMMs for the pipeline

custom_hmm_file.description: File path of a custom HMMER hmm file

domtblout_path.description: Use externally-generated domtblout files. Please read the long description before using
domtblout_path.help_text:
Use externally-generated domtblout files.
The models have to have the same name (identifier) as SocialGene expects, which is a SocialGene-generated hash of the HMM model

domtblout_with_ga.description: Path to hmmsearch results that used cutoffs

domtblout_without_ga.description: Path to hmmsearch results that didn't use cutoffs

hmmsearch_model_threshold.help_text:
From HMMER documentation:
Options controlling model-specific thresholding:

--cut_ga : use profile's GA gathering cutoffs to set all thresholding

--cut_nc : use profile's NC noise cutoffs to set all thresholding

--cut_tc : use profile's TC trusted cutoffs to set all thresholding

pfam_version.description: PFAM version. Ffor version numbers see: http://ftp.ebi.ac.uk/pub/databases/Pfam/releases

antismash_hmms_git_sha.description: Controls which version of antismash the antismash HMMS are pulled from

chembl_version.description: Set (e.g. 31 for chembl version 31) to incorporate chembl into the database

htcondor_specific_parameters.title: HTCONDOR specific parameters
htcondor_specific_parameters.description: These parameters are specific to UW-Madison's CHTC high throuput computing cluster

htcondor.description: Use the --htcondor flag to create files for htcondor, then run again with the results from the external run
htcondor.help_text:
When --htcondor is set the pipeline will only run the steps required to generate and split the non-redundant FASTA file and HMM models for running on external hardware. (Don't delete the work directory until after the next step completes) This will result in a directory `$outdir/htcondor_cache` which contains all the data and scripts and instructions necessary to run highly-parallel `hmmsearch` on CHTC. Then the pipeline is run again, but replacing `--htcondor` with `--domtblout_path` and `--resume`, at which point the rest of the modules will also run.
(Don't delete the work directory until all steps above complete)

See `https://github.com/socialgene/sgnf/blob/main/conf/examples/htcondor.config` for an example

htcondor_prep_directory.description: Where data to be sent to CHTC will be written

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

validationShowHiddenParams.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

fasta.description: not used, required by nf-core linter

input.description: not used, required by nf-core linter

sort_fasta.description: BLAST (and maybe MMseqs2?) differ based on sequence order, setting this to true will sort the protein fasta file first (note: this will make a copy of the data)

publish_dir_mode.description: mode for publishing results form work directories

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

docker_images.title: Docker Images
docker_images.description: Change the docker image tags (advanced, for developers)

sgnf_antismash_dockerimage.description: Specify which docker image tag to use (default is the version synced to pipeline version number)

sgnf_hmmer_dockerimage.description: Specify which docker image tag to use (default is the version synced to pipeline version number)

sgnf_hmmer_plus_dockerimage.description: Specify which docker image tag to use (default is the version synced to pipeline version number)

sgnf_sgpy_dockerimage.description: Specify which docker image tag to use (default is the version synced to pipeline version number)

sgnf_minimal_dockerimage.description: Specify which docker image tag to use (default is the version synced to pipeline version number)
